sentence: “It’s not often a U.S. senator from Texas comes to the Lehigh Valley,” Jonathan DelCollo of Reading said, referring to guest speaker Ted Cruz, who was there to support fellow Republican Dave McCormick’s bid for Pat Toomey’s soon-to-be-vacated Senate seat.
author: Andrew Scott
title: ‘The country looks to Pennsylvania’: Ted Cruz rallies in the Lehigh Valley to kick off candidate’s bid to replace Sen. Pat Toomey

sentence: In her race for the Senate, Barnette calls her three fellow Republicans who recently moved into the state to run – Dave McCormick, Carla Sands and Mehmet Oz – "carpetbaggers," and then she adds, "We don't need to send another rich person to D.C. to represent our interests.
title: Kathy Barnette Hopes To Become US Senate's First Black Republican Woman

author: Natalie Winters
title: A Dominion Voting Systems Rep is Sponsoring a Republican Senate Campaign Fundraiser.

sentence: Ron DeSantis’ PAC and into Honor Pennsylvania, a super PAC backing fellow hedge funder Dave McCormick — and opposing celebrity physician Mehmet Oz — in Pennsylvania’s GOP Senate primary, making Griffin the biggest individual donor to those two groups so far.
title: The Republican megadonor funding the party’s 2022 hopes

author: Michael Dorstewitz
title: The Supreme Court Will Disappoint Joe Biden on Gun Control

sentence: Republicans have spent a record $35 million on TV ads in Pennsylvania, where frontrunners Mehmet Oz and Dave McCormick are bashing one another as a “liberal RINO” and “Wall Street insider,” respectively, in attacks that could be used against them again in a general election.
author: Travis Gettys
title: Republicans 'kick the crap out of each other' in brutal primaries as Democrats sit back and watch
GOP rivals pile on 'Dr. Oz' during forum for Pennsylvania Senate candidates

sentence: Pennsylvania Republican Senate candidate Dave McCormick opposes increasing the federal minimum wage and wants to keep it at its current level of $7.25 an hour, set in 2009, when it was raised from $6.55.
author: Josh Israel
title: Super-Rich GOP Senate Candidate Says Keep Minimum Wage At $7.25

sentence: In the Republican primary field, there is no clear front-runner at the moment with Mehmet Oz sitting at 16% and Dave McCormick coming in with 15%.
author: Lauren Rude
title: Nearly half of voters say they will vote for Republican Congress candidate: Franklin & Marshall poll

sentence: Amid nationwide protests after George Floyd’s murder in 2020, Dave McCormick, then CEO of a hedge fund, emailed his colleagues, calling on them to “be agents of change” and to show “solidarity by denouncing and eradicating structural bigotry around us.” A new ad from a super PAC supporting McCormick’s chief rival in the Republican primary for U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania cites that email as evidence that “McCormick’s woke Connecticut hedge fund supported Black Lives Matter.” But the letter did not mention Black Lives Matter, and it expressed concern not only about racial discrimination and bigotry, but also about “rioting and destruction on city streets across the country.” McCormick campaign spokesperson Jess Szymanski told us that “like President Trump and others,” McCormick was merely “a leader who provided reflections following the death of George Floyd,” and that “Dave never supported BLM and has always stood with law enforcement as a strong law and order candidate.” There’s little mystery why McCormick’s opponents would want to tie him to the Black Lives Matter movement.
author: Robert Farley
title: McCormick’s Denouncement of ‘Structural Bigotry’ Not an Endorsement of BLM

sentence: AP Photos Wall Street executives are pouring millions of dollars into the Republican primary race for Pennsylvania’s open U.S. Senate seat — where veteran physician Dr. Mehmet Oz and former Bridgewater CEO Dave McCormick lead in the polls — making the primary one of the most expensive in the 2022 midterm elections.
author: Brian Schwartz
title: Pennsylvania’s GOP Senate primary draws backing from some of Wall Street’s biggest billionaires, making it one of the most expensive midterm races
